verbs.description: hypostasize (third-person singular simple present hypostasizes, present participle hypostasizing, simple past and past participle hypostasized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make into a distinct substance; to conceive or treat as an existing being; to hypostatize.
examples: The pressed Newtonians  [â€¦]  refused to hypostasize the law of gravitation into an ether.
